intro: Columnea chocoensis var. altaquerensis, commonly known as the highland Columnea, is a species native to the cloud forests of Colombia. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Gesneriaceae family, characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant for collectors and gardeners.
